conversation.thought: Parent_C is lowest on our true priority list. However, no higher-priority families (Parent_D/E/A/B) have applied or even signaled intent through round 21, and we previously committed to keep the place open through round 21 and then be prepared to accept Parent_C in round 22 if no higher-priority APPLY arrives. Parent_C is currently TALKing and asking whether any higher-priority APPLY has been received so far in round 21. To preserve the chance of a higher-priority match, we should not accept now (and cannot, since no APPLY). We should confirm status: none received so far in round 21, but we can only finalize at end of round. Reiterate plan: if no higher-priority APPLY by end of round 21, apply in round 22 and we will accept.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_C. As agreed, I’m submitting my formal [APPLY] in round 22.

Per your update in round 21, you had not received any [APPLY] from a higher-priority family as of that point, and you indicated that if no higher-priority [APPLY] was received by the end of round 21, then an [APPLY] from me in round 22 would be accepted (assuming the place remains available).

Nursery_C remains my top remaining choice. If offered the place, I will accept immediately and complete all enrollment steps the same day (deposit, paperwork, and orientation scheduling). We are fully flexible on start date and can provide any required documents or references right away.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_C
conversation.thought: Nursery_C is the only unmatched nursery and is my top remaining choice. They explicitly committed that if no higher-priority family applied by end of round 21, then an [APPLY] from me in round 22 would be accepted. Therefore I should submit a formal application now, reiterate immediate commitment and readiness to complete enrollment steps the same day, and politely reference the agreed condition.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your formal application in round 22, and thank you for your patience throughout the process.

As agreed: since we did not receive an [APPLY] from any higher-priority family by the end of round 21 and our place remains available, we are pleased to offer you our place at Nursery_C.

Please reply to confirm acceptance and we will send the enrollment packet and next-step details (deposit, paperwork, and orientation scheduling).

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Parent_C has applied this round. Our true priority list ranks Parent_C last, and we previously rejected them repeatedly to wait for higher-priority families (D, E, A, B). However, by round 19 we explicitly committed that if no higher-priority [APPLY] arrived by end of round 21, then an [APPLY] from Parent_C in round 22 would be accepted. In round 21 we confirmed no higher-priority [APPLY] had been received as of that point and held through end of round 21; no evidence of any higher-priority application arriving, and Parent_C has now applied in round 22 as agreed. To avoid leaving the seat unfilled and to honor our commitment, we should accept Parent_C now.
